Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands near edge of foot; reserved edge and underside of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The foot of some Mature Animal Style chalices is decorated with added white bands (see Lemos nos. 674 and 676 from Pitane), as is the case with some Grand Style chalices - Lemos no. 800 from Pitane. For parallels regarding Chalice Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Istros; and for parallels regarding Black Figure Komast chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos nos. 1562 and 1564 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0708) (phase 2)
